Name: Scarborough Beach Rd, Mount Hawthorn
Description: Drivers from Green St get impatient waiting to cross the oncoming traffic onto the eastbound section of Scarborough Beach road and often take risky actions by driving across when there is not much space, and then pushing into traffic to get to the left hand lanes.  I live locally so often see risky behaviour here.
Location: {"Sector": "", "PlaceName": "", "Postal": "6016", "Neighborhood": "Mount Hawthorn", "CountryCode": "AUS", "District": "", "City": "Perth", "Region": "Western Australia", "PostalExt": "", "AddNum": "", "ShortLabel": "Scarborough Beach Rd", "Subregion": "", "LongLabel": "Scarborough Beach Rd, Mount Hawthorn", "Address": "Scarborough Beach Rd", "Match_addr": "Scarborough Beach Rd, Mount Hawthorn, Western Australia, 6016", "Territory": "", "Type": "", "Addr_type": "StreetName", "Block": "", "MetroArea": ""}
Comment 1: Kristy: So many near misses, the area gives little opportunity to cross from Green St to Scarborough Beach road.
Comment 3: Rebecca: There are two lanes of traffic stopping at the lights intersecting Scarborough Bch Rd and Main St facing East. Across the lights the road splits left up Green St and Right carrying on Scarborough bch rd. One lane goes left and both lanes can go right. However from the other side of the lights you really only see the road going up the hill of Green St.  I commonly see cars in the right hand lane drive straight up Green street narrowly missing hitting cars in the left lane who are going right
Comment 4: Gavin: This is a well know danger spot.  When travelling west on SBR I've nearly been hit by a car coming off Green St.  Having two lanes end on Green Street then crossing to a median to head west on SBR just doesn't work.
Comment 10: James: Leaving Green Street travelling west onto Scarborough Beach Road  it is a difficult angle to to see two lanes of vehicles approaching from the east while at the same time judging the gap of vehicles approaching from the west from Main Street and Scarborough Beach Road,
Comment 12: Chris: Traffic westbound on Green St not stopping at compulsory stop sign,traffic in outside lane eastbound on Scarborough Beach Rd crossing lane to enter Green St, right turn lane from Scarborough Beach Rd to Main St blocked by traffic from Green St
Comment 18: Shu: I ALWAYS get cut off here. Horrible, horrible section of road. I purposely drive 10 minutes out of my way to go to work to avoid it.
Comment 19: Claude: Vehicles entering from Green Street wanting to turn left at Powis are unable to do so at many times of the day.  Vehicles entering from  Green Street block the Scarborough Beach Road traffic heading east. Vehicles travelling east on SBR and wishing to access Green Street get into the right hand land and cause chaos when wanting to cut across traffic legally travelling up SBR.
Comment 20: Chloe: The stop sign should be more of a yeild (espically t quiet times when the traffic lights are green, and you are coming down Green St hill, heading for Scarb. Beach Road). When you cross the intersection and join Scarb. Beach Road (before the lights) it is confusing with 3 lanes - people don't know whether to keep left in the island part, if the are turning left, OR using the middle lane. The grey area is if you are keeping in the middle lane, which part of the island do you take, L or R half?
Comment 24: Carmel : Cars and trucks trying to cross over all lanes of traffic to get to Brady street to get to freeway entry. Cars exiting green street not giving way to traffic traffic heading east on scarb Bch Road. Banked up traffic trying to get off green street onto scarb Bch Road. Traffic two or three cars abreast which has exited green street sitting in the middle of the road waiting to get onto scarb beach road then confusion as to which cars move into which lanes/drivers dangerously choosing for themselves
Comment 25: paul: Very difficult to turn right from green street into Scarborough beach road as the intersection is usually full of vehicles waiting at the stop lights. Very bad angle to look for on coming traffic coming along scarborough beach road when you have crossed into the small median strip area.
Comment 28: Elizabeth : Drivers go left into Green Street from right hand lane cutting off traffic going straight ahead on Scarborough Beach Road. Build up of traffic at Green St trying to turn right into Scarborough Beach Road.
Comment 31: Matt: Everyday I watch cars unsafely jump from the right lane of Scarborough Beach Rd, going towards Mt Hawthorn, into Green St, cutting off motorists. The other way is just as dangerous, so many people driving down Green St, towards Osborne Park, not knowing the proper road transition as there are no road markings. For references, the left lane of Green St should merge into the left lane of Scarborough Beach Rd and the right lane should merge into the right lane and/or the right turning lane.
Comment 32: Andrew: The intersection is to congested being so close to traffic lights. plus the angle of the intersectionn  makes visability challenging. impatient motorists exasibate the issues. The major concern is the west bound traffic.
Comment 33: Sandra: Ridiculous intersection with little opportunity to cross safely
Comment 35: Gary: Two main roads intersecting in a very dangerous manner. Vehicles coming down Green St have to cross the busy Scarborough Beach Rd.
Comment 37: Graham: Low angle entry intersection from Green Street.  Conflicts for traffic right turn from Green Street across multiple lanes with poor visibility to left.  Conflict ofdiverging traffic from Scarb beach rd into green street from both lanes; poor pedestrian provisions
Comment 44: ej: have almost had several accidents from people thinking they have right of way when crossing from green street onto scarborough beach road
Comment 48: Steph: There's two aspects here - that messed up merge at Green Street, and the fact there's no facility for pedestrians despite being so close to Glendalough station. The merge point leads to numerous bingles, and there's no pedestrian signalling and I've nearly been run over a few times.
Comment 51: Lee : Almost impossible to turn right on to Scarborough Beach Road from Green Street, there are no traffic lights but the answer is to build a round about at this intersection.
Comment 54: I have seen cars have near misses joining Scarb Beach Road from Green St, possibly because they didn't look properly or the oncoming traffic where driving over the speed limit.
Comment 55: Kara: Risky intersection could use a round about. Cars traveling west on Green Street take risks and jump out in front of oncoming traffic when turning right into right into Scarborough Beach Road

Name: Powis St, Glendalough
Description: Main problem is cyclists turning right off the bike path slipway onto the Powis St bike path and cutting across to the right hand side of the path around a blind corner. Has been work done here to try and help, but some people are just stupid!

Name: 1 Federation St, Mount Hawthorn
Description: Blind corner, narrow path, tree roots, sand patches. Intersection nearby. I have reported this to main roads but nothing has been done. I had an accident here that required hospitalisation. It is very dangerous.

Name: Banksia St & Green St, Joondanna
Description: It's very difficult to turn from Banksia St to Green St and then turn left to Flinders St.
